title: Zed is too easy to snowball: That's the problem
body:
In my opinion, {{champion:238}}  is an easy champion but hard to master
After you have learnt the basic mechanics (basic use of shadows, energy manipulation etc), you are good to go
You do NOT need high-skilled mechanics to kill anyone in lane, simple WEQ poke and then {{summoner:14}} or just level 6 all-in will secure a kill
Tbh, I believe that {{champion:238}} is just face-rolling champ. I don't feel being outplayed when being killed by level 6 Zed{{sticker:sg-ahri-3}} 

Disclaimer: I have played Zed in mid and I feel like he is just too dominant in laning and too easy to snowball throughout the game

Yeah, I think a nice low key nerf would be just to increase the CD on electrocute by like 5 seconds. I kind of feel like assassins are one and done mostly, so I think ideally it procs only once per skirmish or team fight, even in later stages of game.

Or lower the damage and decrease the cooldown... closer to thunderlords which (while it was a bit problematic on release) was quickly made a decent keystone for mages and assassins. Now it's obviously the best choice for assassins who aren't in combat as often and they get a MUCH higher burst rate.

The problem with that was that it was good for repeated, quick trades. While assassins kind of need to be one dimensionally built for all ins. They aren't supposed to be chip away at your hp champs. They are meant to 100-0 you. 

I guess my idea is that it's ok for an assassin to 100-0 someone, but they need to be reliant on having their ult and electrocute available to do it, and if they aren't doing well they will need ignite too.

Zed can be behind if you can outplay him. If you're low elo then he is the best low elo stomper, if you do know how to play him.
